page.title: 18BOOTHBY IN 1920'S CONTINUED
page.content: At school they played games like marbles and hopscotch.There was also a game where with the cards out off a cigarette packets.They then got into corner and threw about 4 - 5 cards at once.If your card landed on another then you claimed that card. When all the boys got the cane at school they used to rub their hands with onions to stop the stinging from the cane.The only problem is your hands smell of onions for a long time! In the village there was a man called "a Carrier" who had a horse and a cart and he used to go to the markets at Grantham and fetch things back for the people in Boothby and they would pay him.They used horses for everything.They had nothing mechanical. His dad used to go to church 3 times on Sunday and chimed 3 bells at once.
